de.esoco.lib.manage

Class ResourceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.manage.ResourceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable

    public class ResourceManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
    Thread-safe resource manager that manages reference counts for the contained resource objects and disposes them if the count reaches zero. For the disposal it uses either the interface Disposable or uses reflection to search for a method of type 'public void dispose()'. If a managed object also implements the Closeable interface it's close() method will be invoked before the dispose() method.

    This class implements the Disposable interface itself so that it can be registered for automatic shutdown.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceManager

        public ResourceManager()
        Creates a new ResourceManager instance.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.Object rID,
                java.lang.Object rObject)
        Adds a single use of an object to this resource manager. If the object is not already managed it will be added to the internal cache. Else only it's reference count will be incremented.
        Parameters:
        rID - The ID to register the object with
        rObject - The instance to add

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Implementation of the Disposable.dispose() method that removes all managed resources and disposes all contained objects.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object rID)
        Simply returns a resource object for a particular ID from this manager. Neither the reference count nor the object state are changed by this method.
        Parameters:
        rID - The ID of the managed object
        Returns:
        The object associated ID or NULL if no such object exists

      • release

        public void release(java.lang.Object rID)
        Releases a single use of an object from the resource manager. The reference count of the object is decremented and if it reaches zero, the referenced object will be disposed and removed from the internal cache.
        Parameters:
        rID - The ID of the instance to be released from the manager

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.Object rID)
        Removes an object from the resource manager completely. The reference count of the object will be ignored and the referenced object will be disposed and removed from the internal cache.
        Parameters:
        rID - The ID of the instance to be removed from the manager
